solution_line_template: The vitamins are ${bottle_price} a bottle and are currently {discount_percent_text}% off so that's {bottle_price}*{discount_percent_decimal} = $<<{bottle_price}*{discount_percent_decimal}={discount_amount_per_bottle}>>{discount_amount_per_bottle} off

The vitamins are ${bottle_price} and they are ${discount_amount_per_bottle} off so they are now {bottle_price}-{discount_amount_per_bottle} = $<<{bottle_price}-{discount_amount_per_bottle}={price_per_bottle_after_discount}>>{price_per_bottle_after_discount}
He has {num_coupons} ${coupon_value} coupons so that's {num_coupons}*{coupon_value} = $<<{num_coupons}*{coupon_value}={total_coupon_value}>>{total_coupon_value} in coupons

He buys {num_bottles_bought} bottles at ${price_per_bottle_after_discount} each so that's {num_bottles_bought}*{price_per_bottle_after_discount} = $<<{num_bottles_bought}*{price_per_bottle_after_discount}={cost_before_coupons}>>{cost_before_coupons}
He has ${total_coupon_value} in coupons so his vitamins will now costs {cost_before_coupons}-{total_coupon_value} = ${final_cost}
